channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2023090972
item.description:
Report X-2023090972

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in unload, was wet on one side. Package removed from vehicle and brought to attention of QA. No leakage escaped outer packaging. DescribePack: Outer packaging was wet on one side, giving appearance of having been loaded on its side. Internal partition was also found to be wet on same side. All 4 jugs of decalcifier were found to have loose caps, causing minor leakage. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package removed from work area and placed in hazmat processing area under exhaust vent. No apparent spillage was found in work area.

item.title: Report X-2023090966
item.description:
Report X-2023090966

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023090966 SequenceEvent: The hazmat was unloaded from a trailer in unload, sent down the IC belt with directional arrows up and had appeared to already have leaked in the trailer before arrival. QA ADMIN responded by placing soiled box into red hazmat tote with blue liner using gloves and sealed hazmat while awaiting disposition. DescribePack: Inner containers leaked from caps due to being loaded incorrectly, liquid leaked out from bottles onto box on upper corners. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a sealed container to discourage any odor or gases from leaking from spillage. 2. X-2023090972 SequenceEvent: Package was found in unload, was wet on one side. Package removed from vehicle and brought to attention of QA. No leakage escaped outer packaging. DescribePack: Outer packaging was wet on one side, giving appearance of having been loaded on its side. Internal partition was also found to be wet on same side. All 4 jugs of decalcifier were found to have loose caps, causing minor leakage. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package removed from work area and placed in hazmat processing area under exhaust vent. No apparent spillage was found in work area.

item.title: Report X-2023090883
item.description:
Report X-2023090883

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-18T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded on the end of the top flaps in the trailer. Trailer door was opened and package dropped to the floor. DescribePack: One glass bottle shattered when package hit the floor. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in hazmat tote, and chemical neutralizer used on floor and swept up.

item.title: Report E-2023100381
item.description:
Report E-2023100381

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one case of printing ink (un1210) damaging one of the inner 6 ounce poly cartridge and releasing 2 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
